intro: Moehringia fontqueri, commonly known as the Sierra mountain mouse-ear, is a small, perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of tiny, hairy leaves. Moehringia fontqueri is adapted to high-altitude environments and is relatively drought-tolerant.
